reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This really is a first class hotel. I stayed here with my three children in August and despite the miserable weather, there was so much for them and I to do. The room was extremely large, beautifully furnished with antiques and had a scottish twist (not a typical bland 5 star hotel room). The bathroom was well appointed and again, what you would expect of a deluxe hotel with Asprey soaps / shampoos etc. Breakfast in the main restaurant is delicious, and offers a wide range of foods. The staff are attentive and nothing is ever too much trouble. The clubhouse and Deseo (where you can choose from a varied menu which includes delicious tapas, and the children can even make their own pizza) were good dining choices in the evening and for lunch with the kids. Sadly, I did not get to eat at the other two more formal restaurants due to travelling alone with the kids, but they both looked superb.
reviews.title: Faded grandeur

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were lucky enough to attend a wedding party at this awesome resort hotel. This is a famous hotel, they have had World summits here. It felt like going back in time to a more elegant age. The breakfast feast was impressive. In June we were blessed with decent weather for Scotland and loved the true Scottish scenery round the hotel. Its not a cheap place, so come prepared, but don't miss it if you get a chance.
reviews.title: Probably the king of Scottish hotels

reviews.text: This was my second trip to Gleneagles, but you forget just what a magnificent experience it is driving up to this grand old hotel, which was a purpose-built resort developed by the railways about 90 or so years ago. It even has its own still-operating railway station. Although we love renting a car in this area of central Scotland. There is so much to do. After a week, we still had many expeditions which will have to wait until next trip!
reviews.title: Fabulous Grande Dame...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was in Braid House. My first impression was that the carpeting could have looked just a little cleaner. In fact, there was a leaf on the staircase leading up to our floor that remained there for days! And the housekeeping could be better. On our first day, a pile of papers sitting on my desk disappeared. As the housekeeper was still in the room, I asked him if he knew what happened with them. He actually had thrown them away! I've never had that happen before. Usually the housekeepers seem reluctant to throw anything away!! However, I ended up loving our room, and the very clean and modern bathroom. Our view over the Scottish hills was just fantastic. And Braid House has small fireplaces, and even in July, these were useful.
reviews.title: Standards falling

reviews.text: As I mentioned, the location of this hotel is fantastic. This part of Scotland is full of beautiful scenery, fun things to visit and great shopping -- Glenalmond Tweed near Perth is fantastic for wonderful and unique gifts. But there is so much to do at Gleneagles as well. We tried most activities. Off-road driving was the best. Difficult course, but so educational with a fantastic instructor. Shooting also has wonderful facilities. And there are very few places that I know of where you can do hawking. Don't miss it. These activities do come at a high price, but they are all memorable, and Gleneagles provides all gear, down to Barbour jackets and wellies if you need them. Believe me, they have your size! Amazing selection of gear for your use. The price for this is quite high, however, but worth it, I think.
reviews.title: Breath taking environment.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Personally, I don't find the lobby of the hotel terribly inspiring. And the furniture is honestly quite horrendous. I don't even know quite how to describe the strange and bulky furniture. Definitely could use a redo. Also, the coffee lounge area and the Deseo Restaurant are very unappealing to me. Kind of has the look of an upscale holiday camp. Another area to remodel...The shops are quite appealing, and this little shopping area has an original and authentic look with finely maintained shopfronts. Love walking through there.
reviews.title: Amazing Resort - not just a hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But walking the grounds of Gleneagles is quite special. And the breakfasts are hearty and delicious Scottish fare. Two types of smoked salmon, black and white pudding and all the rest. Nice baked goods and custom omelettes. The other area of the hotel I really do like is the Dormy Clubhouse Restaurant. This is casual dining in a modern space overlooking the golf course. They have a selection of items, from traditional to tandoori. Not outstanding, but quite delicous while overlooking the lovely grounds. And the short walk down there is also extremely pleasant.
reviews.title: what a setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well I guess we are lucky enough to go here at least once a year as we are Glenmore owners so we have a week each November to revel in the loveliness that is gleneagles. Over the years we have grown to love everything about this place so we are probably biased!!! We have seen the hotel come back to life over the past 5 years in particular and we put that down to extra revenue that glenmore has brought. It gives trade to the hotel even on off season mid week nights which is great. The golf is fantastic. Our fave restaurant is the Emporium side of Deseo which is the quiet area. We always order whatever we like in terms of seafood and meats and the team never let us down even though it's not on the menu! A lobster and huge piece of fillet after a winters day round the queens course is the perfect way to end the day! Last year the clubhouse was revamped and it is pretty cool and modern now with very good food to be had and the Dubai-es que smoking area is fun! It's a fan static haven in the hills and we have the weeks counted until our next visit in November! What I would say is if you are going to moan about price then dont come here as its about the experience and if you want to check your bank balance it's not a place for you!!
reviews.title: An institution, we love this iconic Scottish retreat!

reviews.text: We were disappointed with our stay. The service was poor and the common areas were not very well maintained. The activity center offered some great experiences such as falconery and clay shooting, but the overall feeling of the hotel was not warm and friendly.
